title: Who is the best music artist to cope with depression with? - Quora

response.answer_text: That depends on you and your personal taste and music and what speaks to you. However, I can give you my choices for music that I personally find the most encouraging whenever I’m anxious and feeling any sort of depression. I think, for me, having uplifting and fast-pasted electronic music with dreamy aesthetics, a solid beat, and positive lyrics helps a lot. Owl City Or any music by Adam Young. His songs are the epitome of positivity. He often sings about having depression and how there is always hope and things will get better… you just gotta keep on trucking. Some of his songs about having/overcoming depression and negative thought processes:    Oceanlab I don’t think there’s a music project that is anymore dreamy, beautiful, and dopamine-inducing than Oceanlab.    Mandisa I’m a christian and so naturally, I like to listen to a lot of christian music. I don’t know if you’re into that, but I promise you christian music is a wonderful cure for depression. The songs are clean, positive, encouraging, and remind you that you’re not alone, that you matter, that God loves you, He hurts with you, and His intention is not that you suffer. Mandisa is one of my favorites!    Danny Gokey Another christian artist who I can’t get enough of.    Honestly, I’d suggest any christian music artist. Francesca Battistelli, Jason Gray, The Newsboys, MercyMe, Hillsong Young & Free, Plumb, Britt Nicole, Tobymac, Group 1 Crew, Capital Kings, SHONLOCK, Chris Howland, Gawvi. So many good ones. Progressive House Music As for just in general… any progressive house music instantly lifts my mood and reminds me everything is going to be okay.    So hopefully you like these artists and their music will help! <3

When I'm sad, I feel better listening to sad music. Not sure if that's normal. A dancey, happy, singable song like Paul Simon’s wonderful “Kodachrome” won't cheer me up. REM’s “Nightswimming,” “Find the River” or Pattie Griffin’s incomparable “Useless Desires” somehow make me feel less down.  Almost anything by Leonard Cohen. Doesn't make sense, but there you have it.
